seed_summaries.title: SELF-RAG: Learning to Retrieve, Generate, and Critique Through Self-Reflection

justification_evidence: Introduces multi-modal fusion across retrieval, re-ranking, and generation
Claims robustness and performance boosts without fine-tuning
Describes systematic dissection of RAG pipeline but limited specifics
red_flags: Vague evaluation setup and missing baselines/details

ideas.title: SELF-RAG: Learning to Retrieve, Generate, and Critique Through Self-Reflection
justification_evidence: Trains a single LM with reflection tokens to decide retrieve/generate/support
Two-stage training: distilled critic then generator interleaving tokens and passages
Evaluated across QA/reasoning/long-form with improved citation precision/recall
Acknowledges residual unsupported claims and need for attributions

ideas.title: Meta-Learning for Adaptive Retrieval-Augmented Generation
justification_evidence: Meta-learning (e.g., MAML) to adapt retrieval strategies across tasks
Framework outlines retriever, generator, and meta-learner components
Claims generalization and efficiency improvements across diverse queries
red_flags: Complexity and potential instability of meta-optimization

ideas.title: Evaluating the Robustness of Retrieval-Augmented Generation to Adversarial Retrieval
justification_evidence: Defines adversarial retrieval threat model manipulating retrieved docs
Proposes experimental evaluation with accuracy/F1/ROUGE under attack
Includes adversarial training framework to improve robustness
Positions relative to prompt injection/data poisoning literature

ideas.title: Investigating the Potential of Neuro-Symbolic Architectures for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
justification_evidence: Proposes neuro-symbolic architecture to enhance interpretability/reasoning
Benchmark comparison vs purely neural baselines
Notes dataset suitability and complexity as limitations
red_flags: Added architectural complexity may reduce efficiency
